alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 10:20PM MST until December 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 to 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Kellogg, Dobson Pass, Osburn, Pinehurst, Fernwood, Fourth Of July Pass, Lookout Pass, Wallace, St. Maries, and Mullan. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM Wednesday to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
